sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: A boolean (true/false) variable can be either true or false (see boolean type).
sections.text_content: A boolean (true/false) variable can be either true or false (see boolean type).
sections.mdown_content: A **boolean** (**true**/**false**) variable can be either **true** or **false** (see **boolean** type).

sections.title: Example
code:
var found : boolean := false
        var word : int
        for i : 1 .. 10
            get word
            found := found or word = "gold"
        end for
        if found = true then
            put "Found 'gold' in the ten words"
        end if

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: The line if found=true then can be simplified to if found then with no change to the meaning of the program.
sections.text_content: The line if found=true then can be simplified to if found then with no change to the meaning of the program.
sections.mdown_content: The line **if** _found_=**true** **then** can be simplified to **if** _found_ **then** with no change to the meaning of the program.
